solution_line_template: First find the number of water breaks James takes: {total_work_minutes} minutes / {water_break_interval} minutes/water break = <<{total_work_minutes}/{water_break_interval}={num_water_breaks}>>{num_water_breaks} water breaks

Then find the number of sitting breaks James takes: {total_work_minutes} minutes / {sitting_break_interval} minutes/sitting break = <<{total_work_minutes}/{sitting_break_interval}={num_sitting_breaks}>>{num_sitting_breaks} sitting breaks

Then subtract the number of sitting breaks from the number of water breaks to find the difference: {num_water_breaks} breaks - {num_sitting_breaks} breaks = <<{num_water_breaks}-{num_sitting_breaks}={difference_in_breaks}>>{difference_in_breaks} breaks
